qas.question: In what year did Louis XIV move his court to Versailles?
What monuments did Louis XIV have constructed?

answers.text: Collège des Quatre-Nations, Place Vendôme, Place des Victoires, and began Les Invalides.

qas.question: What was the reason behind demolishing the city walls?

answers.text: To show that the city was safe against attack

qas.question: In what city was the French Academy of Science founded

context: Louis XIV distrusted the Parisians and moved his court to Versailles in <a0_0>1682<a0_0/>, but his reign also saw an unprecedented flourishing of the arts and sciences in <a3_0>Paris<a3_0/>. The Comédie-Française, the Academy of Painting, and the French Academy of Sciences were founded and made their headquarters in the city. <a2_0>To show that the city was safe against attack<a2_0/>, he had the city walls demolished, replacing them with Grands Boulevards. To leave monuments to his reign, he built the <a1_0>Collège des Quatre-Nations, Place Vendôme, Place des Victoires, and began Les Invalides.
